DataElement.preferredDefinition: A thing produced by or resulting from a process. EXAMPLE(S): drug, device. The FDA list of regulated products - animal and human drugs; therapeutic biologics; allergenics; cell, tissue and gene therapy products; blood components; blood derivative products; devices; animal (pets and livestock) and human food/feed (medicated and un-medicated); cosmetics; pet treats; and dietary supplements. A coded value specifying the non-unique textual identifier for the material. EXAMPLE(S): aspirin, tobacco, caffeine. NOTE(S): The granularity of the code may vary depending on the specificity of the material. For example, acetaminophen, Tylenol, Tylenol 250 mg gel cap.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The end result of a manufacturing process; anything that is produced.:The tangible substance that goes into the makeup of a physical object._The words or language units by which a thing is known.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation.
